channel.title: Tor Browser keeps enabling Javascript globally
channel.description:
It doesn't happen every time, but every so often when I start up TorBrowser and begin browsing my favorite hidden services, I'll be alerted that I have Javascript enabled.
I keep going into the settings, and changing the default profile to not allow anything. But it only lasts for a few restarts, then reverts to the useless "Enable JS Globally" as the default.
I am using the new TorBrowser 8 alpha/beta.
Very frustrating. I am very concerned that I have javascript enabled randomly.

item.title: Tor Browser keeps enabling Javascript globally
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi LakeMonster

LakeMonster:

Is it possible to backup profile and bookmarks

I believe you can find the Tor Browser profile along with bookmarkbackups in /home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/TorBrowser/Data/Browser/profile.default

You can also find profile by punching in about:profiles in the TBB address bar.

You can then make a backup using .tar or what ever backup method you would like.

I’m sure you know this is coming

Using bookmarks is strongly discouraged because it can degrade anonymity by making your Tor Browser profile more unique

Off-topic:

There is a great thread on Whonix forums about using multiple Tor Browser profiles. Thought you might be interested.

https:forums.whonix.org/t/tor-browser-tbb-profile-with-custom-about-config-settings/4888

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser keeps enabling Javascript globally

item.title: Tor Browser keeps enabling Javascript globally
item.dc:creator: LakeMonster
item.description:
And when opening a new TorBrowser wnidow, NoScript is reverted to “allow” in the default setting. Despite the original window remaining in “disabled”.

Incredibly frustrating. Is it possible to revert from 8.0a9 to 7.5.6?

Is it possible to backup profile and bookmarks?

Read full topic
